revised_title: Advances in Surface Analysis Techniques: Photoelectron, Auger Electron, and Metastable De-Excitation Spectroscopy
tldr: This article discusses recent trends in surface analysis techniques, focusing on photoelectron, Auger electron, and metastable de-excitation spectroscopy. The authors explore the potential of these methods for studying surfaces and interfaces at high resolution, extracting chemical information from small areas, and understanding the bonding and interactions of adsorbates with surfaces.
